verse: Then the Lord said to Moses,
“See, I have ·chosen [called by name] Bezalel son of Uri from the tribe of Judah. (Uri was the son of Hur.)
I have filled Bezalel with the ·Spirit [or spirit] of God and have given him the ·skill [wisdom], ability, and knowledge to do all kinds of work.
He is able to ·design [plan] pieces to be made from gold, silver, and bronze,
to cut jewels and put them in metal, to ·carve [engrave] wood, and to do all kinds of work.

I have also ·chosen [given him] Oholiab son of Ahisamach from the tribe of Dan to work with Bezalel. I have given ·skills [wisdom] to all the craftsmen, and they will be able to make all these things I have commanded you:
the Meeting Tent, the Ark of the ·Agreement [Covenant; Treaty; Testimony], the ·lid that covers [mercy seat; atonement cover] the Ark, and ·everything in [all the utensils of] the Tent.
This includes the table and ·everything on it [all its utensils], the pure gold lampstand and ·everything with it [all its utensils], the altar of incense,
the altar for burnt offerings and ·everything used with it [all its utensils], and the bowl and the stand under it.
They will make the woven clothes and the ·holy [sacred] clothes for Aaron and the clothes for his sons to wear when they serve as priests.
They will also make the special olive oil used ·in appointing people and things to the service of the Lord [for anointing], and the sweet-smelling incense for the Holy Place.
Then the Lord said to Moses,

“Tell the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel], ‘You must ·keep the rules about [guard; keep] my Sabbaths, because they will be a sign [reminders of the covenant; 9:13; 17:11] between you and me from now on. In this way you will know that I, the Lord, make you holy.

“‘·Make the Sabbath a holy day [Keep/Guard the Sabbath for it is holy]. If anyone ·treats the Sabbath like any other day [profanes/desecrates the Sabbath] that person must be put to death; anyone who works on the Sabbath day must be cut off from his people [20:8–11].
There are six days for working, but the seventh day is a day of rest, a day holy for the Lord. Anyone who works during the Sabbath day must be put to death.

The ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] must ·remember [keep; guard] the Sabbath day as an ·agreement [covenant; treaty] between them and me ·that will continue from now on [throughout their generations].

The Sabbath day will be a sign between me and the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] forever, because in six days I, the Lord, made the ·sky [heavens] and the earth. On the seventh day I did not work; I rested [Gen. 2:1–3].’”
When the Lord finished speaking to Moses on Mount Sinai, he gave him the two stone tablets with the ·Agreement [Covenant; Testimony; Treaty] written on them, written by the finger of God.
